descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This class will provide students with a comprehensive overview of HD video production, specifically geared towards producing short documentaries that tell human stories. Emphasis is put on the use of character, conflict, drama, and surprise in telling these documentary stories. We will also look at different documentary styles and how narrative structures like story arcs are implemented. Students will learn documentary production with a journalism focus: reporting, camera technique, lighting, and sound recording in the field. Students will create a seven-ten minute documentary project in a group of 2. They will research and write a treatment, cast charismatic characters, get signed releases, shoot, and edit the film. All group members must have equal roles in this process. Post production: editing on a and Mac on Premiere/Final Cut Pro, sound mixing in Premiere/FCP, and exporting will also be introduced. All video assignments must be uploaded to vimeo.com.
